intro: Octolobus grandis, commonly known as the large-flowered starflower, is a member of the Onagraceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features opposite, lanceolate leaves with serrated edges, and it produces small, elongated fruits that contain seeds. Native to regions of North America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. Octolobus grandis is often found in wetlands, streambanks, and other moist habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
